Name: 100 Projects for Peace
Description: Encourages young adults to develop innovative, community-centered, and scalable responses to the world’s most pressing issues by grassroots activities that address root causes of conflict and promote peace

Name: Academic Enrichment Fund
Description: Provides financial support for individual students for academic work, with strong preference to work related to a specific for-credit project
Note: Word document accessible via fund website

Name: Ann Cornelisen Fellowship
Description: Provides support for study of a current spoken language in any country outside the United States, preferably in conjunction with interest in sociology, diplomatic service or international law
Note: - Open to rising juniors and seniors

Name: Asprey CCAS Student Research Enhancement (SRE) Awards
Description: Provides support to science students to expand their research experiences
Note: Activities must occur and awarded funds must be used before JUNE 30 of the academic year in which the grant was awarded.

Name: Beckman Scholars Program
Description: Provides robust faculty-mentored research experiences for exceptional undergraduate students in the fields of Biology, Chemistry, Biochemistry, and Neuroscience & Behavior. This program will provide students with generous stipends, robust mentorship, funding for supplies and conference travel, and an unprecedented opportunity at Vassar to pursue their research interests across two summers and a full academic year.
Note:
- Student stipend: $18,200 TOTAL
-- Summer Funding — $6,800 per summer for two summers
-- Academic Year Funding — $4,600 for the academic year
-- Student scientific travel and research supply funds: $2,800

Name: Burnam Summer Fellowships
Description: Provides support for pursuing meaningful summer projects or internships that involve work with non-profit or other community-based agencies either in the United States or abroad
Note: - Typical amount $3,000-$5,000 but can be unlimited

Name: Community Fellows Program
Description: Provides fund for students to work full-time at non-profit and government agencies in Dutchess County

Name: Creative Arts Across Disciplines Initiative
Description: Provides opportunities for students to work together on creative arts or design-based research projects under the guidance of a faculty mentor or mentors

Name: Ellen Rudnick ’72 Student Entrepreneur Fund
Description: Provides financial support for Vassar students of all class years to pursue summer opportunities in start-ups/entrepreneurial ventures.

Name: Environmental Research Institute (ERI) Student Funding
Description: Supports student research in environmental sciences, including multidisciplinary work on projects that cross boundaries of environmental sciences, social sciences, policy, humanities, and other multidisciplinary collaborations. Funding is available to support mentored research, summer research or field courses, and travel to conference and meetings. Apply online and email Lynn Christenson and Catherine Meyer (cameyer@vassar.edu).
Award Amount: Varies based on the fund awarded

Name: Ford Scholars Program
Description: Supports faculty and student collaboration in summer research projects in the humanities and social sciences
Note: - Open to rising sophomores, juniors and seniors

Name: Geraldine Gewirtz Friedman ’41 Career Development Fund
Description: Provides resources for students of drama, film, literature or the visual arts who wish to pursue special professional opportunities in their chosen fields
Note:
- Amount up to $800
- Word document accessible via fund website

Name: Grand Challenges Summer Catalyst Research Experience
Description: Provides opportunities for students to work closely with faculty and staff mentors and peers to learn about the dynamics of institutional leadership and development, and the history and conceptual foundations of the Inclusive Excellence model
Note: - Open to rising sophomores, juniors and seniors

Name: Harold S. Geneen Fund for Internships in Corporate Life
Description: Supports Vassar students at internships associated with corporate governance, compliance, and business ethics.
Major Restriction: Open to all majors; preference for Economics,Political Science

Name: Internship Grant Fund
Description: Provides financial support to Vassar students who are participating in low-pay and unpaid summer internship opportunities.
Note:
- Range is $500-$4,500
- Deadline is rolling from March to May

Name:
Marlene Shepper Cooperman ’63 
Memorial Fund
Description: Provides financial assistance, typically $5,000, for students who are enrolled in a summer language and cultural study program, or are conducting research relating to their studies
Major Restriction: Restricted to French and Francophone Studies majors
Note: - This stipend is to provide for living and study expenses for a summer (8-10 weeks) in France

Name: On-campus Summer Student Employment
Description: Provides full-time, hourly summer employment in Vassar offices/ departments
Note: - Job registration will be open March 20th-April 21st. Jobs are only available to students who meet financial aid eligibility requirements.

Name: Steven J. Hueglin ’74 Media Studies Internship
Description: Provides resources for students of Media Studies who wish to pursue experiences in media-related workplace environments. Grants are available to support student experiences in a wide range of media-related workplaces, including internships, fieldwork, or other professional positions during the summer.
Primary Sponsoring Department: Director of the Media Studies Program
Note: - Primary criterion for evaluating funding requests is the project’s support of the student’s curricular plan in Media Studies

Name: Tananbaum Family Leadership Program for Work and Development
Description: Provides internship support, mentoring and enriching educational opportunities for Vassar juniors who demonstrate a commitment to professional and personal growth, achievement and success.
Note:
- $5,000 for domestic internships; $6,000 for international
- Summer earning relief for students with unpaid or low-pay internships – up to $2,450

Name: The June Ross Marks ’49 Travel Fund
Description: Provides support for travel connected to academic work
Note:
- Amount up to $500
- Word document accessible via fund website

Name: The Vassar Fund for Living and Working Abroad
Description: Provides grants for students to pursue summer internships in foreign countries
Major Restriction: Open to all majors; preference for French & Francophone Studies,Humanities,Multi-disciplinary
Note:
- Range is $5,000-$10,000
- Tiered preference for (1) French & Francophone Studies major; 2) French & Francophone Studies correlate; 3) humanities major (including the arts, foreign languages and literatures, and social sciences) or a multi-disciplinary program. Preference for students with limited experience abroad.

Name: Thompson Bartlett Fellowships for Economics
Description: Encourages outstanding and highly motivated students to pursue summer opportunities that will allow them to apply their economics education in a practical setting and contribute to US economic advancement
Major Restriction: Restricted to Economics majors and correlates

Name: Thompson Bartlett Fellowships for Science, Mathematics and Computer Science
Description: Encourages outstanding and highly motivated students to pursue summer opportunities that will allow them to build their scientific, mathematical and computer science knowledge and advance their career goals for American scientific advancement

Name: Undergraduate Research Summer Institute (URSI)
Description: Provides opportunities for students to engage in cutting-edge research under the supervision of a faculty mentor
Note: - Open to rising sophomores, juniors and seniors

Name: Woodward Student Veterans Fund
Description: Supports veterans enrolled at Vassar pursuing unpaid or low-paid summer internships
